mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Jonathan Trumbull, Jr. to George Washington, 1788 October 28
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Trumbull, Jonathan, 1740-1809
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter focuses on political situation in Connecticut--Gen'l Assembly of Connecticut passing resolves for organizing Congress under new constitution--will appoint electors in January, "this appointment the Assembly have retained in their own power - thinking it more likely to be exercised with judgment & discretion than it would be to be entrusted in the hands of the people at large"--Senators elected--Representatives to be chosen by people--mentions circular letter from New York state convention--few discordant notes in Connecticut assembly--no disagreement over president, but over vice-president--desires Bowdoin for office, since Adams is talked of for Supreme Court--asks after [David] Humphreys. Autograph letter, signature is missing, 3 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States--Politics and government
